intro: Lachnostachys brevispicata, commonly known as the short-spurred larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers with short, spurred petals, which are characteristic of the Ranunculaceae family. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. L. brevispicata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
